headline: Is It Time To Reassess Block (SQ) After Recent Share Price Weakness?
summary: If you are wondering whether Block's current share price really reflects what the business is worth, you are not alone. This article is here to focus squarely on that question. Block last closed at US$51.94, with returns of 3.1% decline over 7 days, 21.2% decline over 30 days, 20.3% decline year to date, 20.4% decline over 1 year and 32.2% decline over 3 years, while the 5 year return stands at 77.8% decline. Recently, headlines around Block have focused on broader questions about the growth...

headline: Block Announces Fourth Quarter 2025 Results
summary: DISTRIBUTED-WORK-MODEL/OAKLAND, Calif., February 26, 2026--Block, Inc. (NYSE: XYZ) has posted its results for the fourth quarter of 2025 on the Financials section of its Investor Relations website at investors.block.xyz. Block will host a conference call and earnings webcast at 2:00 p.m. Pacific Time / 5:00 p.m. Eastern Time today to discuss these financial results.

Block will host a conference call and earnings webcast at 2:00 p.m. Pacific Time / 5:00 p.m. Eastern Time today to discuss these financial results.

headline: Jack Dorsey’s Block to Lay Off 4,000 Employees in AI Remake
summary: Block  the payments company founded by  Jack Dorsey  that includes Square and Cash App, said Thursday that it plans to lay off 40% of its workforce, or more than 4,000 employees.  Dorsey alluded to artificial-intelligence tools as the reason for the cuts in a letter to shareholders.  “The core thesis is simple,” wrote Dorsey.

content.title: Jack Dorsey’s Block to Lay Off 4,000 Employees in AI Remake
content.summary: Block  the payments company founded by  Jack Dorsey  that includes Square and Cash App, said Thursday that it plans to lay off 40% of its workforce, or more than 4,000 employees.  Dorsey alluded to artificial-intelligence tools as the reason for the cuts in a letter to shareholders.  “The core thesis is simple,” wrote Dorsey.

headline: Dorsey’s Block slashes workforce 40% to embrace AI-native future, shares gain
summary: Investing.com -- Block Inc (NYSE:XYZ) shares soared 22% in after-hours trading Thursday following a robust earnings report and a sweeping structural overhaul, which would eliminate 40% of the company’s workforce. Chief Executive Jack Dorsey announced the company will pivot toward an "intelligence-native" model to drive long-term shareholder value. The financial technology giant reported fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $0.65 per share, edging past the $0.64 analyst consensus. Quarterly revenu

Chief Executive Jack Dorsey announced the company will pivot toward an "intelligence-native" model to drive long-term shareholder value. The financial technology giant reported fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $0.65 per share, edging past the $0.64 analyst consensus. Quarterly revenu

headline: Jack Dorsey’s Block to cut nearly half its workforce in AI overhaul, shares surge
summary: Block on Thursday said it will cut over 4,000 jobs, nearly half its workforce, as advances in AI reshape how it builds ‌and runs its business, sending its shares up 23% in after-hours trading.  The layoffs signal how the ‌AI boom is translating from hype into workforce changes, fueling long-held concerns among workers and economists that the technology could eliminate roles ​even as it boosts productivity and profits.  In a post ⁠on social media platform X, Dorsey said Block opted for a single deep round of cuts instead of multiple smaller layoffs over time.

content.title: Jack Dorsey’s Block to cut nearly half its workforce in AI overhaul, shares surge
content.summary: Block on Thursday said it will cut over 4,000 jobs, nearly half its workforce, as advances in AI reshape how it builds ‌and runs its business, sending its shares up 23% in after-hours trading.  The layoffs signal how the ‌AI boom is translating from hype into workforce changes, fueling long-held concerns among workers and economists that the technology could eliminate roles ​even as it boosts productivity and profits.  In a post ⁠on social media platform X, Dorsey said Block opted for a single deep round of cuts instead of multiple smaller layoffs over time.
